p: Ranaviruses of fish (family Iridoviridae) were also sequenced by NGS. The European sheatfish virus was isolated from wels catfish ( Silurus glanis) and from brown bullhead ( Ameiurus nebulosus) in Europe ( Ahne et al., 1998, Feher et al., 2016), while the epizootic hematopoietic necrosis virus, another ranavirus was described in Australia earlier ( Steiner et al., 1991). These viruses share very high nucleotide identity alongside their entire genome (99%). After sequencing their whole genome by NGS, regions showing insertions/deletions were identified, which allows us to design PCR-based diagnostic that differentiates between the viruses without sequencing them ( Mavian et al., 2012). NGS could also be used, if the isolation of a virus fails.
